name: counterplay
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an attacking move or series of moves by a player in a weaker position in a game, especially in chess: Unless White can find some plausible counterplay, he's going to be on the defensive. To be a good poker player, you have to think of counterplays that take advantage of your opponent's tendencies.
More examplesFewer examplesBlack must seek counterplay before White consolidates his space advantage.Breaking down White's pawn centre has given Black freedom and counterplay.Black has adequate counter-play but hopes for more.He never got any real counterplay on the kingside.
